meanings.definition: To divide into smaller parts or sections.
meanings.sent1: She is subdividing the cake into equal slices.
meanings.sent2: The builder is subdividing the land into individual plots.
meanings.sent3: The chef was so focused on subdividing the ingredients that she forgot to add salt.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a map, subdividing thoughts into neat little compartments.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush danced across the canvas, subdividing colors with precision.

meanings.definition: To separate into smaller groups or categories.
meanings.sent1: The teacher is subdividing the students into study groups.
meanings.sent2: The app is great for subdividing your expenses into different categories.
meanings.sent3: The magician was so skilled at subdividing the cards that even the audience was amazed.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a way of subdividing the crowd into those who listened and those who ignored.
meanings.sent5: The organizer was an expert at subdividing tasks, making everything seem more manageable.
